Q.Question1: To celebrate her year end bonus, Megyn is thinking of spending some of her earnings on gambling. She thought of spending it on a chance based game like _________________.

Option1.info: Roulette, Slots and Bingo are chance based games.

Option2.info: Roulette, Slots and Bingo are chance based games.

Option3.info: Roulette, Slots and Bingo are chance based games.

Option4.info: Roulette, Slots and Bingo are chance based games.

Option1.info: Chance based games are purely random.

Option2.info: Chance based games are purely random.

Option3.info: Chance based games are purely random.

Option4.info: Chance based games are purely random.

Q.Question3: which means that the odds of winning _________________ each time you play.

Option1.info: The odds of winning random games never change.

Option2.info: The odds of winning random games never change.

Option3.info: The odds of winning random games never change.

Option4.info: The odds of winning random games never change.

Q.Question4: She also thought about spending it on a skill based game like _________________.

Option1.info: Horse race betting and Poker are chance based games.

Option2.info: Horse race betting and Poker are chance based games.

Option3.info: Horse race betting and Poker are chance based games.

Option4.info: Horse race betting and Poker are chance based games.

Q.Question5: However, she understands that _________________ the outcome of the game.

Option1.info: A gambler cannot affect the outcome of a skill based game.

Option2.info: A gambler cannot affect the outcome of a skill based game.

Option3.info: A gambler cannot affect the outcome of a skill based game.

Option4.info: A gambler cannot affect the outcome of a skill based game.

Q.Question6: She finally decided on buying a Lotto Max ticket, even though a _________________ ticket had better odds of winning.

Option1.info: Scratch and win has the best odds of winning something.

Option2.info: Scratch and win has the best odds of winning something.

Option3.info: Scratch and win has the best odds of winning something.

Option4.info: Scratch and win has the best odds of winning something.

Q.Question7: Megyn doesn’t expect to win the ultimate prize, because quite frankly _________________ has a better chance of happening.

Option1.info: All of these events have better chances of happening than winning the Lotto.

Option2.info: All of these events have better chances of happening than winning the Lotto.

Option3.info: All of these events have better chances of happening than winning the Lotto.

Option4.info: All of these events have better chances of happening than winning the Lotto.

Q.Question1: To celebrate her year end bonus, Megyn is thinking of spending some of her earnings on gambling. She thought of spending it on a chance based game like _________________.

Option1.info: This is correct! Roulette is a chance based game, so as slots!

Option2.info: This is correct! Slots is a chance based game, so as Roulette!

Option1.info: This is correct! Chance based games are purely random

Q.Question3: which means that the odds of winning _________________ each time you play.

Option1.info: This is correct! The odds of winning never changes in chance based games.

Q.Question4: She also thought about spending it on a skill based game like _________________.

Option1.info: This is correct! Poker is a skill based game, so as a horse race betting.

Q.Question5: However, she understands that _________________ the outcome of the game.

Option1.info: Oops, she can’t affect the outcome of the game. Skill and strategy can play a role in these games, but you still don't control the cards that are being dealt or the outcome of an event that is being waged.

Option3.info: Oops, she can’t affect the outcome of the game. Skill and strategy can play a role in these games, but you still don't control the cards that are being dealt or the outcome of an event that is being waged.

Option4.info: Oops, she can’t affect the outcome of the game. Skill and strategy can play a role in these games, but you still don't control the cards that are being dealt or the outcome of an event that is being waged.

Q.Question6: She finally decided on buying a Lotto Max ticket, even though a _________________ ticket had better odds of winning.

Option3.info: This is correct! Scratch and win has better odds of winning than a Lotto Max ticket.
